result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa J Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500), Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs in Ct 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct 2.    If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
TIME SERVED AS OF 3-2-15
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: Ct 1

miscConds.notes: Costs in Ct 1 are to be paid as a condition of probation in Ct 2.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with any Wal-Mart Store in Washington County.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Kevin Stewart.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa J Brown

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend Ct 2 to Misd Retail Theft PTAC, 943.50(1m)(b)(4)(a); Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 and guilty plea to amended Ct 2.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1 & guilty on amended Ct 2.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
15R 003111;  Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #107330 on 2/11/15
$1000 cash bond amended to $150 cash bond; No contact with any Walmart Store; No contact with KS

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Case resolved.  State moves to amend charge to Misd Bailjumping; Court expresses concern w/this amendment and will not proceed w/sentencing today.  Counsel req bond be modified.  Court amends bond to $150 cash.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
No contact with any Walmart Store; No contac with KS

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $1000 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  SPD will represent.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
